rooms.description: Open-plan living and kitchen area with wheelchair accessible design, incorporating ample space for movement and storage. Designed to include a comfortable seating area near the entrance per Vastu principles.
Master bedroom featuring en-suite bathroom designed for accessibility with minimal thresholds and grab bars installed as required by local norms.
Additional bedroom intended for children or guests, following Vastu alignments with north-east direction for positive energy flow.
Dedicated library area integrating built-in bookshelves, adjustable seating, and natural lighting to create a serene environment. Ensures adequate space for wheelchair maneuverability.
Accessible bathroom in the master bedroom with grab rails and non-slip surfaces.

openings.description: Wheelchair-accessible entrance with a wide door (minimum 36 inches) following local norms, placed in the north or east according to Vastu for auspicious entry.
Large window ensuring natural light and cross ventilation in the living area; aligned per Vastu principles with north-east elevation for optimal energy flow.
Window positioned to allow adequate ventilation and sunlight into the kitchen while maintaining privacy as per traditional Kerala style.

notes: This design integrates Traditional Kerala Nalukettu elements with modern accessibility features. The layout is designed for a family of four on a 30x50 feet plot, ensuring compliance with local building norms and Vastu principles. All design elements prioritize wheelchair accessibility, safety, and cultural significance.
